intro: Trichodesma incanum var. griffithii, commonly known as the hairy trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its distinctive hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually trifoliate, and the flowers are often pale yellow or greenish-white, attracting various pollinators. This variant is noted for its ecological importance in stabilizing soils and providing forage for livestock in its native habitats.
